meanings.definition: To apply a new layer of gloss or shine to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to regloss her nails before the party.
meanings.sent2: The car owner wanted to regloss the vehicle for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: After spilling juice on the table, she had to regloss it to hide the stain.
meanings.sent4: The artist reglossed the painting, making the colors pop even more.
meanings.sent5: He used a special product to regloss his shoes, making them look brand new.

meanings.definition: To restore the original gloss or shine to something.
meanings.sent1: The furniture restorer had to regloss the antique table.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler reglossed the ring to make it sparkle like new.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally scratched her phone screen and had to regloss it.
meanings.sent4: The rain had dulled the statue, so they reglossed it to bring back its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight helped regloss the car's paint, giving it a glossy finish.

meanings.sent1: The regloss of the floor made it shine brightly.
meanings.sent2: He admired the regloss of the wood after the polishing.
meanings.sent3: The regloss of the trophy made it look even more impressive.
meanings.sent4: The regloss of the marble gave the room a luxurious feel.
meanings.sent5: The regloss of the mirror reflected the room in a new light.
